title: Till which year did the Scottish Regiments wear kilts into battle? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think official moves had been made to enforce wearing of battle dress/fatigues by 1939.  Lt Col Mad Jack Churchill was still wearing a kilt into the Second World War - but he wasn't exactly what you'd call normal.Famous for landing on the beaches with bagpipes and claymore in hand, and what is almost certainly the last UK wartime killing with a longbow. For interest, Jack Churchill's obituary is linked.Lieutenant-Colonel Jack Churchill  The St Nazaire raid in 1942, reportedly included mean who changed into their kilts[1] , but that seems to be an exception of passionate men on what seemed to be very close to a suicide mission. Footnotes[1] Into the Jaws of Death: The True Story of the Legendary Raid on Saint-Nazaire - review - History in an Hour

A battalion of the Queens Own Cameron Highlanders is said to have defied regulations ordering Highland regiments to adopt battledress blouse and trousers of khaki serge for wear in the field and in 1940 was still wearing the kilt during the battle of France. Pipers of all Highland regiments could be seen wearing the kilt throughout the war.  Pipe Major “Rab’ Roy, 2nd Bn. The Black Watch, Tobruk 1941 680 × 500  Pipers of Q.O.Cameron Highlanders, St Valery-en-Caux, Normandy 1944 {EDIT} The young woman in the lower photo wears a Cameron Highlander kilt she had kept since June 1940 when a battalion of the regiment as part of the 51st Highland Division had been besieged in the town, in an unsuccessful attempt to embark for Britain during the Battle of France and subsequently forced to surrender.
